definitions.definition: a person who will legally receive money, property, or a title from another person, especially an older member of the same family, when that other person dies:
examples: The guest of honour was the Romanov heir to the throne of all Russia.

definitions.definition: someone who now has responsibility for dealing with a problem or situation that existed or was created earlier:
examples: The French finance minister is heir to a tradition of central control that goes back to Louis XIV.

definitions.definition: someone who continues to do the work of someone important who has died, or someone who has the same position as the previous person who held that position
